question: Are there any compulsory pricing regulations for specific insurance lines or types of coverage in your country?
Does your country have any state-backed or mandatory reinsurance pools or schemes?
If so, please identify which insurance lines or cover types are included.
Is there a legally required minimum retention that insurers must maintain before ceding premiums?
If applicable, what is the minimum retention percentage that must be held?
Are you obligated to go through a state reinsurer or approved intermediary before transferring a policy to Generali?
If yes, please mention the name of the required reinsurer or intermediary.
If applicable, what is the commission rate allowed for the reinsurer?
If applicable, what percentage of retention applies to the reinsurer?
Do local laws require applying a Reinsurance Tax (RI Tax) when remitting premiums to Generali?
If yes, what is the applicable rate or fixed amount of the RI Tax?
If yes, how is the RI Tax calculated — on gross or net premiums?
Is the Cash Before Cover rule enforced in your jurisdiction?
What are your normal payment terms for premium settlement in days from the invoice date?
What are your cancellation terms if a premium remains unpaid after the due date?
What is your standard policy cancellation notice period in days?
Can you issue backdated policies where coverage starts before the issuance date?
Are you permitted to provide a certificate or temporary proof of insurance before the full policy is released?
Can policies be issued prior to signing the Slip or Reinsurance Covernote?
Is it mandatory in your country to use a broker for policy issuance?
Besides your local currency, in which other currencies are policies allowed to be issued?
Do you have the option to take part in a Centralized Premium Collection (CPC) system?
If so, can you only receive deductions like commissions, brokerage fees, and taxes directly?
How frequently do you submit Reinsurance Bordereaux to Generali — monthly, quarterly, etc.?
After closing a reporting period, how many days do you need to send Premium and Claims Bordereaux?
What is the name of your banking institution?
Please provide your official bank account number.
Which currency is your bank account maintained in?
What jurisdiction governs your Casualty and Financial Lines policies?
If you exclude pandemics or communicable diseases (like COVID-19), please share the exclusion wording.
Do you exclude pandemic-related losses as triggers under Public Authority clauses for Business Interruption?
If so, please share the exact wording used in your Public Authority clause.
Do your policy documents contain a Sanctions Clause?
If yes, please share the text of the Sanctions Clause.
Do you perform sanctions screening or use tools to comply with local and global sanction rules?
For Marine Cargo policies, are there Incoterms requiring local insurance coverage?
Is local insurance mandatory for marine imports, exports, or domestic shipments?
Is broker approval of the draft policy required before issuance under local regulation?
Are you authorized to engage and collaborate with Third-Party Administrators (TPAs)?
Do you keep an approved list of Third-Party Administrators you work with?
Can you delegate claim-handling authority to a TPA or Generali as reinsurer?
Can clients request an English-language, non-binding copy of the policy?
Do you need to collect specific documents, such as KYC, before issuing a local policy?
Are Property policies allowed to be issued on an All Risks basis in your country?
If Cyber risk is excluded, please provide the exclusion wording.
Do certain business lines or coverage types have mandatory tariffs in your jurisdiction?
Are there government-operated or compulsory reinsurance schemes in your country?
If applicable, which lines of business or insurance covers fall under these schemes?
Is there a minimum level of retention required before ceding premiums to reinsurers?
If so, please mention the required retention percentage.
Do regulations require involving a state reinsurer or designated intermediary before working with Generali?
If yes, please indicate the reinsurer’s name.
If yes, please state the commission rate that applies to the reinsurer.
If yes, please specify the reinsurer’s retention percentage.

If yes, is the RI Tax calculated based on gross or net premium?
Does the Cash Before Cover requirement apply in your jurisdiction?
What are your usual premium payment terms in days from invoice issuance?
What cancellation rules apply if a client fails to pay within the payment window?
What is the standard notice period for policy cancellation in your country?
Is backdating of policies permitted, allowing retroactive coverage?
Can a temporary certificate or insurance proof be issued before the main policy?
Are policies allowed to be issued before the Slip or Covernote is signed?
Must policies be issued through a licensed broker in your country?
Apart from the local currency, what other currencies can policies be written in?
Can your company take part in a Centralized Premium Collection program?
If yes, can you only directly receive deductions like brokerage, taxes, and fees?
How often are Reinsurance Bordereaux reports sent to Generali — monthly or quarterly?
After each reporting period, how many days do you take to deliver Premium and Claims Bordereaux?

In what currency is your bank account maintained?

Is insurance required locally for import, export, or domestic cargo transport?
